trans-unit.source: Abstract class that, when implemented, animates a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rotation3D"></xref> value.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Rotation3DAnimationBase"></xref> class.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Rotation3DAnimationBase"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true.`
Gets the current value of the animation.
The origin value provided to the animation if the animation does not have its own start value.
If this animation is the first in a composition chain it will be the base value of the property being animated; otherwise it will be the value returned by the previous animation in the chain.
The destination value provided to the animation if the animation does not have its own destination value.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock"></xref> which can generate the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentTime"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentProgress"></xref> value to be used by the animation to generate its output value.
The current value of the animation.
Gets the current value of the animation.
The origin value provided to the animation if the animation does not have its own start value.
If this animation is the first in a composition chain it will be the base value of the property being animated; otherwise it will be the value returned by the previous animation in the chain.
The destination value provided to the animation if the animation does not have its own destination value.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock"></xref> which can generate the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentTime"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentProgress"></xref> value to be used by the animation to generate its output value.
The current value of the animation.
Calculates a value that represents the current value of the property being animated, as determined by the host animation.

If the `defaultOriginValue` is the first in the composition chain, this value will be the snapshot value (if one is available) or the base property value; otherwise this value will be the value returned by the previous animation in the chain with an <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock> that is not <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.Stopped%2A>.

The `defaultDestinationValue` is the base value if the animation is in the first composition layer of animations on a property; otherwise the value is the output value from the previous composition layer of animations for the property.
The suggested origin value, used if the animation does not have its own explicitly set start value.
The suggested destination value, used if the animation does not have its own explicitly set end value.

An <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock"></xref> that generates the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentTime"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentProgress"></xref> used by the host animation.
The calculated value of the property, as determined by the current animation.
Gets the type of value this animation generates.
The type of value produced by this animation.
